Deals 1.5% of max health as damage in 0.75-second intervals, starting 0.75 seconds after cast, resulting in 10 instances. 0.5 seconds after the last self-damage instance, the duration ends. Applies generic outgoing damage amplification on the target. Stacks additively with other sources of generic outgoing damage manipulation. The amplification affects only spell damage the target deals that is not flagged as HP removal
Successive casts on the same target do not update the attack speed or spell damage amplification value but refresh the duration

SHARD NOTES Bloodseeker's attacks now deal additional pure damage based on the target's max health. This damage is considered as a conditional attack damage bonus. Although the attack damage bonus values are not displayed in the HUD, it is still considered and directly added to Bloodseeker's attack damage. The attack damage bonus values are not considered by critical strike, lifesteal, or cleave, and it can be reduced only by flat reductions (e.g. damage block). Since it is considered bonus attack damage, it is not affected by percentage-based attack damage bonuses or reductions. This additional damage bonus is only applied when self-casting Bloodrage. Bloodrage's own outgoing damage amplification does not affect the percentage-based pure damage either. Bloodrage's percentage-based lifesteal is affected by lifesteal manipulation. Does not work against  Roshan

description: Chases down low health enemies with increased speed. The Flayed Twins' obscene demand for blood could only be met through constant carnage, a task for which Strygwyr was more than suited. Driven by insatiable Thirst, the Bloodseeker senses blood of the mortally wounded from leagues away, and chases them down with eager speed. Through sacred markings on his gear, the blood of the freshly sacrificed flows directly to the Flayed Ones, leaving just enough to mend his wounds and fuel his imbued Rage. Strygwyr paints the land with a crimson ring, silencing foes caught in this Blood Ritual. Forcing difficult decisions on his enemies, for those who run only hasten their own demise. The Bloodseeker Ruptures every artery, causing his victim to hemorrhage with each step. To satisfy the demands of the Flayed Twins, Bloodseeker even goes as far to sacrifice some of his, spraying his own blood around him in a Bloody Mist. By blood loss or by Strygwyr's tribal blades, death is but a foregone conclusion.  Carry Disabler Jungler Nuker Initiator ★☆☆
trivia: With Thirst, Bloodseeker is the only hero which can reach the game's absolute movement speed limit of 10,000 movement speed.[1] However, this is not achievable in a normal match.
This part of Blood Rite's Link▶️ sound effect makes use of Link▶️ this Bloodseeker voice response.
Alongside the Dawnbreaker, Strygwyr speaks in a Hispanic accent.[2]

Despite the character having an Aztec or Incan motif, Strygwyr likely a Welsh-influenced rendering of the Romanian word 'strigoi', meaning poltergeist, often used in folklore in reference to vampires.
Bloodseeker's Thirst trigger response Link▶️ "Blood is in the air." is most likely a reference to the song "Love is in the air".
Bloodseeker's respawning response Link▶️ "Don't be negative… be positive!" is a reference to the blood types B-Positive and B-Negative.
Bloodseeker's Rupture kill response Link▶️ "Lie down… have a cookie." is a reference to blood donation procedures where patients lie down and are given sweet treats to compensate for the sugar loss.

Bloodseeker's battle begin response Link▶️ "I love the smell of serum in the morning." is a reference to a quote of the movie Apocalypse Now where Lieutenant Colonel Bill Kilgore says "I love the smell of napalm in the Morning."
Bloodseeker's death response Link▶️ "Sangre…sagrada." is spanish for "Sacred/Holy blood".

Some of his rival responses towards Brewmaster has references to alcohol. Bloodseeker says this in the context of Brewmaster's blood having so much alcohol content that it replaces most of his blood. As he would sometimes say: Link▶️ "I think that one had some blood in his alcohol stream." Link▶️ "The Twins shall drink your blood and eat the worm." is a reference to the mezcal worm often found in bottles of mezcal, a liquor of Mexican origin. history: Strygwyr the Bloodseeker is a ritually sanctioned hunter, hound of the Flayed Twins, sent down from the mist-shrouded peaks of Xhacatocatl in search of blood. The Flayed Ones require oceanic amounts of blood to keep them sated and placated, and would soon drain their mountain empire of its populace if the priests of the high plateaus did not appease them. Strygwyr therefore goes out in search of carnage. The vital energy of any blood he lets, flows immediately to the Twins through the sacred markings on his weapons and armor. Over the years, he has come to embody the energy of a vicious hound; in battle he is savage as a jackal. Beneath the Mask of the Bloodseeker, in the rush of bloody quenching, it is said that you can sometime see the features of the Flayers taking direct possession of their hound.
